column4: i am working with fortran code on a external hard drive in 10.10 and it now says "permission denied" when i try to run ./a.out...this worked fine in all previous version of ubuntu I have used...thanks
wht filesystem is the external hd?
i believe it's fat32...is there an easy way to check in linux?
check mount output. You proberly need to mount it with the proper options. then everything will be 'executable' on it.. which can be an annoyance.
you may want to do your development on a ubuntu/linux filesystem. ive had odd quirks with keeping code on vfat/fat/ntfs
It's just that I work on computers in two different locations so I like having the hard drive as a go between
also is it strange that this works fine using 10.04 on my laptop?
chedk fstab.. perhaps you got different options.
or the  systems are set to use diffrent default optuions.
fstab is the config file. :) You may want to run the 'ntfs-config' program and check some of the options.
when i run ntfs-config only my windows partition shows up
there should be some  check box;s covering external media also.
what ubuntu version are you on right now?
you culd make a custom fstab entry for the thing. and just mount/unmount it as needed and not use the automounting feature.
okay, why does 10.10 make this harder?
never noticed.. then again. i never use executables from vfat/ntfs...
okay, thank you for this help...I think I'll have to deal with this issue when I have more time
